page.title: 15Transport Taff's Well
page.content: The Taffs Well settlement is aligned NW to SE, along the axis of the transport system. The south west part is predominantly industrialised. In comparison, the north west consists mainly of woodland and rough pasture. In the SW area there are two railway lines, one now dismantled, providing evidence of the former importance of the extractive industries. The main Cardiff-Merthyr roads complete the transport pattern. A new housing estate has been developed between the rail axis and the road axis, possibly to accommodate employees of nearby works in the south and west of the area.
